intro: Jacea neapolitana, commonly known as the Naples jacea, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley. The plant features slender stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal remedies. Jacea neapolitana thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or streamside habitats.
